creator: slehtonen@digitalchocolate.com
text:
Does the LogFormat option %D really indicate the time requests take in microseconds ?

"%D The time taken to serve the request, in microseconds."

When adding this to our LogFormat with Apache 2.2.8, we can see most of the requests in the range of 100-300, which would seem more reasonable if they were milliseconds, not microseconds.

According the source code, %D does indicate the time in microseconds.
If you doubt, compare the result of %T.
creator: takashi.asfbugzilla@tks.st
